title: How Dali rewrote art history as a deck of tarot cards
text:
“Mistakes are almost always of a sacred nature. Never try to correct them,” said Salvador Dalí. “On the contrary: rationalise them, understand them thoroughly.” The Spanish artist was also a great believer in the virtues of paranoia – detecting links between things that are not logically connected. Dalí thought that by painting in a sustained state of paranoia he could “systematise confusion” and thus “contribute to the total discrediting of the world of reality”.
